abstract: Mr. Horn reluctantly left Warner Brothers last year, indelicately squeezed out after he successfully guided the “Harry Potter” franchise. He replaces Rich Ross, who was fired in March.
snippet: Mr. Horn reluctantly left Warner Brothers last year, indelicately squeezed out after he successfully guided the “Harry Potter” franchise. He replaces Rich Ross, who was fired in March.
lead_paragraph: 7:36 a.m. | Updated LOS ANGELES — The Walt Disney Company has turned to one of Hollywood’s senior statesmen to calm its turbulent film studio.

headline.main: Alan Horn Is Named Chairman of Disney Studios
